title: Rene Magritte
description: This retrospective exhibit held over eighty paintings by Rene Magritte. It was the first time American viewers could assess his work in a large-scale, comprehensive exhibit held by a major museum. Magritte was largely identified as a surrealist who produced lifelike, dream motivated, symbolic paintings. According to co-curator of the exhibit James Thrall Soby, Magritte “made consistent use of what Apollinaire called art’s greatest potential— surprise.” This was evident in several of the works shown in the exhibit, which often included an odd assortment of objects decontextualized from their intended use. Known as the “Middle Class Magician,” Magritte transposed reality into fantasy with his painting career, and was finally given his due in America with this historic exhibit.
